original_solution_mapping.L1: Tom can buy 1000/2=<<1000/2=500>>500 for half price.
original_solution_mapping.L2: He will spend $.50/2= $<<.50/2=.25>>.25 on the half-priced bricks.
original_solution_mapping.L3: Thus, he will spend 500*$.25=$<<500*.25=125>>125 on the half-priced bricks.
original_solution_mapping.L4: He will spend 500*$.50=$<<500*.50=250>>250 on the full-priced bricks.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 929.
    Returns: the total dollars Tom spends on bricks.
    """
    # L1
    total_bricks = 1000 # 1000 bricks
    half_divisor = 2 # half of the bricks
    bricks_half_price = total_bricks / half_divisor

    # L2
    full_price_per_brick = 0.50 # $.50
    discount_divisor = 2 # 50% off
    price_per_brick_half_price = full_price_per_brick / discount_divisor

    # L3
    cost_half_price_bricks = bricks_half_price * price_per_brick_half_price

    # L4
    cost_full_price_bricks = bricks_half_price * full_price_per_brick

    # L5
    total_cost = cost_half_price_bricks + cost_full_price_bricks

    # FA
    answer = total_cost
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Tom can buy {total_bricks}/{half_divisor}=<<{total_bricks}/{half_divisor}={bricks_half_price}>>{bricks_half_price} for half price.
He will spend $.{full_price_per_brick}/{discount_divisor}= $<<{full_price_per_brick}/{discount_divisor}={price_per_brick_half_price}>>{price_per_brick_half_price} on the half-priced bricks.

Thus, he will spend {bricks_half_price}*$.{price_per_brick_half_price}=${cost_half_price_bricks}<<{bricks_half_price}*{price_per_brick_half_price}={cost_half_price_bricks}>>{cost_half_price_bricks} on the half-priced bricks.

He will spend {bricks_half_price}*$.{full_price_per_brick}=${cost_full_price_bricks}<<{bricks_half_price}*{full_price_per_brick}={cost_full_price_bricks}>>{cost_full_price_bricks} on the full-priced bricks.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Tom can buy 1000/2=<<1000/2=500>>500 for half price.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: He will spend $.0.5/2= $<<0.5/2=0.25>>0.25 on the half-priced bricks.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: Thus, he will spend 500*$.1000=$500000<<500*1000=500000>>500000 on the half-priced bricks.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: He will spend 500*$.0.5=$250<<500*0.5=250>>250 on the full-priced bricks.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'total_bricks' (value: 1000) was used instead of 'price_per_brick_half_price' (value: 0.25).
